radiographic_examinations.findings: Heterogeneous region of low attenuation in the right frontal lobe, without evidence of enhancement after contrast, suggesting a tumor rather than a territorial infarction.

Heterogeneous, infiltrative mass in the right frontal lobe involving both gray and white matter with some mass effect. The bulk of the lesion is bright on T2-weighted sequences and isointense to slightly hypointense on T1-weighted sequences. No appreciable enhancement observed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Residual area of T2 hyperintensity after surgery did not enhance with gadolinium and did not have characteristics of malignancy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Small residual focus of bright signal after four cycles of chemotherapy, did not enhance with gadolinium contrast medium.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The initial high-grade component is no longer present; however, some dorsolateral infiltrative signal remains.
